name: notself
text: I would also like to hear about a car that runs on free Tomatohol

name: saint
text: science is always ahead of funding. this is basic.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Pat is being dragged to Perdition, but his fantasy soliloquy is lucid and reasonable. Well, isn't that always the way?

name: billyamericana
text: Pat likes Moby as a person; his music is another matter.

name: thesyndicate88
text: I'm sure Pat likes Moby's music as well. He is, after all, a huge dick.

name: gormster
text:
HUGE slam on Moby out of nowhere

Seriously, though, that Moby track is pretty good. It's just a shame he feels the need to repeat it eighteen times on every album.

name: connormc
text:
man i like moby and i can't speak against this

well goddamn played man

name: leon_sumbitches
text: It seems he has to struggle to control his own pretend world.

name: petitegitan
text: Sometimes they get the best of you.

name: love_is_so_punk
text: I think it's because his fantasy life is to hate everything and be a dick, but he's trying the whole peaceful thing out because his fantasies don't include being tentacle raped by a hick-tar.

name: direhaggis
text: I love how no one has either taken notice or isn't bothering to help.

name: epicurus
text:
direhaggle, it is night time. Maybe eight or nine o'clock at night.

On the sidewalk, a cat is sliding on his back along the sidewalk while talking calmly to himself about paper or something.

Just ahead of him is some sort of strange object - perhaps a large bug, or more likely, one of those fancy new skateboards the kids are using these days.

name: ssddr
text: Pat's leg is very broken in that last pannel.

name: carlyle
text: No, it's pretty easy to get it like that. If you rotate your thigh correctly and if you have a small amount of gravity, your legs can go pretty wacky.

name: solle
text: This strip will forever be in my top ten.

name: i_love_kate
text: Do you love it so?

name: aliiis
text: It is nice, and good.

name: tekende
text: No one has ruined it yet.

name: aliiis
text: I heart you tekende

name: tekende
text: What's up aliiis I'm tekende don't you know

name: sp1derbaby
text: With their filthy eyes.

name: cailetshadow
text:
I would buy this car. Curious neighbors would enter my house weeks later to find me unconscious, surrounded by empty tomatohol bottles.

The car had never been used.

name: muddgirl
text: My finger slipped. This comment is not Lame, it is chubby :(

name: rumblefish
text: That's ok faerie Airalea! We do not wish you any harm!

name: epicurus
text: Speak for yourself rumblefish. I am the Hitler of Fairies.

name: rumblefish
text: So you want to eradicate Fairies, or create a nation of pure blooded Fairies? Fey creatures need to know whether to hide from you in the basement of their adorable acorn houses or discretely read your literature.

name: anonymous44
text: note the way his left leg is folded upwards like the hangman on Tarot cards.

name: laudabilis
text: That is really creepy.

name: scrumpton
text:
Says Cthulhu?

(Please don't change your avatar, if you do I'll look quite silly.)

name: spicyponyhead
text: Actually, in most Tarot decks, the hanged man's leg is shown folded inwards. I won't dare to try and embed an image, but Google can show you.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Now I've gone and said the same thing you already mentioned.
To make amends, I will tell you an occult secret- the only correctly drawn and colored deck is the one by Oswald Wirth. The Only one.
Fwiw.

[IMGS OFF]

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Actually, it's not. You're thinking of the Hanged Man, but his leg is crossed. However, he is upside-down, which we can also say of Pat, as his entire world has turned upside-down. The fata banjana now runs its inevitable course.

If the card is as you describe, it is incorrectly drawn.
I know this, for also I sleep that way sometimes.

name: epicurus
text: anonymous44, you are simultaneously pretty cool and really creepy for noticing that particular detail.

name: c_dizzle
text: Being an alternative energy scientist, there's no way I can't give this a 5. ...and fuck Moby.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: I would talk to Moby, in order to get free wasabi peas.

name: i_love_kate
text: Is that wasabi as in wasabe? As in peas that are hell of spicy?

name: laserblade
text: If that's wasabe as in wasabi, then yes.  Peas that are hella spicy because they have been powdered with a variant of horseradish.

name: i_love_kate
text: ...When did I ever think that wasabi was spelled like that?

name: laserblade
text: 5 months ago, apparently.

name: i_love_kate
text:
Whaaat a difference...
Five months makes!
Three thousand seven hundred and twenty little hours...

name: epicurus
text:
I thought Pat was handling this pretty well until the last panel reminded me that he is being dragged off by a fucking LIVING VIOLIN MONSTER FROM HELL while he discusses tomatohol with Moby in his imagination.

Like, this is Achewood: deal with it.

name: deusoma
text: Imagine you're walking down the street and a talking cat wearing glasses and shoes is dragged down the street by a banjo fretboard while he talks about meeting Moby in a paper store. How the hell do you respond to the world showing you something like that?

name: daidai
text: I would first wonder where the cat obtained glasses.

name: atmus
text: I would at first be concerned for the cat, as he is obviously in danger of some sort.  After hearing him speak about Moby and paper stores, I would assume he is a dick, and not care that he is in danger.

name: tonyhighwind
text:
Look.
Ponder.
Keep on walkin'.

name: agentmuu
text: Haha after all that talking Pat does he's only been dragged about three feet the entire time... what an inefficient banjo-monster

name: goatmasterflash
text: After waffling for several minutes on whether or not I wanted to quibble over the matter, I decided that I should point out that the walkway shown in the first panel is not the same as the walkway seen in the last panel. This is too bad, because it certainly would have been funnier your way.

name: tekende
text: I'm pretty sure it is the same, it's just crudely drawn.

name: epicurus
text:
I have looked into this matter exhaustively, and it defnitely is not the same one. Note the width of the stairs, if not the bushes. Or perhaps the biggest clue, notice where the sidewalk tiles line up relative to the steps.

That banjo monster movin' tite speed.

name: lucid
text:
Oh crap. The kind of grazing Pat's back must be enduring seems inconsistent with his ability to calmly fantasise about meeting Moby in a paper shop. I don't want to believe agentmuu's revelation was incorrect.

Wait, I am in control.

Oh, would you look at that, it IS just crudely drawn after all!

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Mr. Bear: I have Pay Pal!
Onstad: FedEx, why do you have to be that way with me.

name: tekende
text:
This is one of my favorite Onstad blogs.

"I rose to discover a package from FedEx at my rear-facing bedroom door. You don't just walk up to my rear bedroom door %u2014 you have to go through a couple gates and get pretty intimate with my personal space. This FedEx driver, as far as I was concerned, had very nearly taken off her boots, gotten under the covers, and asked me to sign for the package across the expanse of her tough-nippled but silken-skinned breast."

name: firesign
text: Tomatohol... one of those twice-as-expensive-as-they-should-be "specialty use" alcohols specifically for making Bloody Marys?

name: fermatprime
text: Not twice-as-expensive-as-anything. Free tomatohol.

name: shoinan
text:
"No one has ruined it yet"

Yep, Pat in a nutshell.

name: gigs
text: How odd; if I were to meet Moby, I would certainly have to pretend I'm somewhere peaceful, instead of panicking.

name: epoc_jones
text: o God please no i don't wanna hear about his car please please please no no no
